Question
========

Which of the following statements about SQL and relational database management systems (RDBMSs) are **false**? 


Answerlist
----------
* The theoretical foundation for RDBMSs was developed in the 1960s and 1970s by E.F. Codd. 
* The first SQL databases were implemented in the 1970s. 
* MySQL is the only flavor of SQL worth learning about. 
* All SQL implementations adhere to strict standards, so any code you write for MySQL will automatically run verbatim on PostgreSQL. 
* `dplyr` was created before SQL. 

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False. E.F. Codd *did* develop the theoretical foundation for SQL.
* False. The first SQL databases *were* implemented in the 1970s.
* True. MySQL is just one worthwhile implementation of SQL.
* True. Although there is an ANSI SQL standard, it is only loosely followed. 
* True. `dplyr` was created with SQL in mind.
